Key Match Events: Krzysztof Piatek scored Poland's last penalty, while Daniel James missed for Wales.
Chris Mepham received two yellow cards but was given a hero’s ovation.
Harry Wilson and Neco Williams both scored penalties for Wales.
Jakub Piotrowski went close for Poland with a curling shot in extra time.
Pre-Game Insights: Rob Page admitted it would have been foolish not to practice penalties.
Michal Probierz, Poland’s manager, stated 'Finals and playoffs aren’t played, they’re won.'
Post-Match Reflections: Rob Page was gutted after Wales lost the match on penalties.
Chris Mepham was given a hero’s ovation after leaving the field.
Connor Roberts left the field in tears after picking up an injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wojciech Szczesny made an outstanding save to keep out a header from Kieffer Moore.
Ben Davies settled Wales’s nerves after scoring a penalty.
The match was described as a game of few chances, with penalties deciding the outcome.
